meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>manipulate</kanji>, so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to manipulate</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: A guy using <reading>eye arts</reading> (あやつ) isn't a great guy, it's the type of guy who might try <vocabulary>to manipulate</vocabulary> you via hypnosis of the eyes.
